name: StudentCurriculum-Courses-GET-getCourses
description: [Student Curriculum] GET /courses/{ID} — Retrieves a single course instance.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

name: StudentCurriculum-CourseSections-GET-getCourseSections
description: [Student Curriculum] GET /courseSections — Retrieves a collection of course sections.

schema.name: academicLevel
schema.description: The academic level used by the course section. You can specify using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicLevels from studentAcademicFoundation service.

schema.name: academicPeriod
schema.description: The starting academic period of the course section. You can specify using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicPeriods from studentAcademicFoundation service.

schema.name: campusLocation
schema.description: query parameter: campusLocation

schema.name: course
schema.description: The course for the course section. You can specify by using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /courses.

schema.name: courseSubject
schema.description: The subject for the course section. You can specify by using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /courseSubjects.

schema.name: deliveryMode
schema.description: The delivery mode for the course section.You can specify using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use the following values: Correspondence, Hybrid, In-Person, Online, Other Distance Mode.

schema.name: instructionalFormat
schema.description: The instructional format for the course section. You can specify using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use the following values: Clinical, Combination, Discussion, Experiential, Independent Study, Internship, Laboratory, Lecture, Recitation, Research, Seminar, Service Learning, Studio, Thesis, Workshop.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offeringAcademicUnit
schema.description: The academic unit that offers this course section. You can specify multiple academicUnit query parameters using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicUnits from studentAcademicFoundation service.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: owningAcademicUnit
schema.description: The academic unit that owns this course section. You can specify by using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicUnits from studentAcademicFoundation service.

schema.name: owningInstitutionalAcademicUnit
schema.description: The institutional academic unit that owns this course section. You can specify by using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicUnits from studentAcademicFoundation service.

schema.name: status
schema.description: The section status of the course section. You can specify using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use the following values: Preliminary, Open, Closed, Waitlist, Hold, Canceled.

name: StudentCurriculum-CourseSections-GET-getCourseSections_1
description: [Student Curriculum] GET /courseSections/{ID} — Retrieves a single course section instance.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

name: StudentCurriculum-Courses-GET-getCourses_1
description: [Student Curriculum] GET /courses — Retrieves a collection of courses.

schema.name: academicLevel
schema.description: The academic level used by the courses. You can specify using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicLevels from studentAcademicFoundation service.

schema.name: academicUnit
schema.description: The academic unit used by the course. You can specify multiple academicUnit query parameters using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicUnits from studentAcademicFoundation service.

schema.name: courseSubject
schema.description: The subject for the course. You can specify by using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /courseSubjects.

schema.name: effectiveDate
schema.description: The effective date of the Course's effective-dated fields: competencies, academicLevel, typicalPeriodsOffered, academicUnits, allowedLocations, owningInstitutionalAcademicUnit, tags, description, eligibilityRule, instructionalFormats, learningOutcomes, and title. Format for input is as such: YYYY-MM-DD.

schema.name: institutionalAcademicUnit
schema.description: The institution academic unit used by the courses. You can specify by using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicUnits from studentAcademicFoundation service.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: search
schema.description: query parameter: search

name: StudentCurriculum-CourseSubjects-GET-getCourseSubjects
description: [Student Curriculum] GET /courseSubjects — Retrieves a collection of course subjects. Secured by: Manage: Curriculum Management Scope: Student Records

schema.name: inactive
schema.description: Indicates if a Course Subject is inactive.

schema.name: institutionalAcademicUnit
schema.description: The Institution Academic Units.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

name: StudentCurriculum-CourseSubjects-GET-getCourseSubjects_1
description: [Student Curriculum] GET /courseSubjects/{ID} — Retrieves a collection of course subjects. Secured by: Manage: Curriculum Management Scope: Student Records

schema.name: ID
